issue.title: mail.google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mail.google.com/mail/u/1/#starred/FMfcgzQbgcPKvKTKQLtQNcxQpRbxznWQ](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fmail%2Fu%2F1%2F%23starred%2FFMfcgzQbgcPKvKTKQLtQNcxQpRbxznWQ) ### Comment > I could not open link from official Google Ads mail to open my Google Ads and download my invoice. No settings or filters were possible to include an exception so I had to turn off whole extension. While I wanted to create personal filter, even if that was possible, it's still not correct behavior. Either make exception for such official sites or invent a better system. We are not talking about ads anymore, we are talking about opening links from official emails from important services. ### Screenshots

issue.title: winfuture.de

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Give users more control over the google search ai overview
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I deeply appreciate the effort you put into blocking the AI overview in google search. However, simply put it within the other annoyances filter seems a bit too straight forward. After all, I don't think this is as "bad" or "annoying" as the popups for website logins.


### Proposed solution

Would it be possible to provide a better control of this that allows the user to just turn this on/off without sacrificing all other cool blocks within the other annoyances filter?

Thanks!


### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: If the AI result appeared instantly, or at least in a collapsed form without distracting flickering, we would not block it. If you use AI chats, just open a separate tab with it.

issue.title: Give users more control over the google search ai overview
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I deeply appreciate the effort you put into blocking the AI overview in google search. However, simply put it within the other annoyances filter seems a bit too straight forward. After all, I don't think this is as "bad" or "annoying" as the popups for website logins.


### Proposed solution

Would it be possible to provide a better control of this that allows the user to just turn this on/off without sacrificing all other cool blocks within the other annoyances filter?

Thanks!


### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: Brave answer is collapsed by default similar to Google. Wrong of me to share an uncollapsed screenshot.

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

# Creating the pull request ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [x] This is not an ad/bug report; - [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers; - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website; - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons share, like, tweet, etc; - [ ] Annoyances pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [ ] Filters maintenance. ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210136 ### Add your comment and screenshots Other possibile solution: `telefonino.forumfree.it##div[class^="overlay"]` instead of ``` telefonino.forumfree.it##.overlay telefonino.forumfree.it##.overlay_mgid ``` Screenshot:
